thread.title: Regional chiefs step up pressure on German federation boss
thread.title_full: Regional chiefs step up pressure on German federation boss

title: Regional chiefs step up pressure on German federation boss
text:
Germany's influential regional football chiefs step up pressure on federation president THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   10:19   10:20   
Subjects: 
Germany (196) 

FRANKFURT, Germany — Germany's influential regional football bosses are stepping up pressure on national federation president Wolfgang Niersbach to come up with a quick explanation on what happened to the money that one report has said was used to buy votes to bring the 2006 World Cup to Germany. 
Niersbach has denied any wrongdoing, but acknowledged that it remains unknown what the money was used for despite launching an internal investigation months ago. 
German weekly Der Spiegel reported Friday that a slush fund of 10.3 million Swiss francs (about $6 million at that time) was set up to buy the votes of four Asian representatives on the FIFA executive committee. 
Several regional chiefs have urged Niersbach to provide a quick explanation, saying they had been told about the internal probe only recently.
